medical_history.chief_complaint: Right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain, nausea, and emesis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has a 12-hour history of persistent and constant RUQ pain, nausea, and emesis. There were no fevers or chills at home, and no changes in bowel habits. Symptoms were not noted to improve or worsen with eating, laying down, or sitting up.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Aortic stenosis, coronary artery disease (CAD) status post bioprosthetic valve replacement, essential thrombocytosis (on hydroxyurea), atrial fibrillation and flutter, sick sinus syndrome, complete heart block status post atrioventricular junction (AVJ) ablation and pacemaker placement, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), diverticulosis, prostate cancer status post radiation and adjuvant androgen ablation, asthma, obstructive sleep apnea (on CPAP), hypertension (HTN), history of myocardial infarction and carotid stenosis status post left carotid endarterectomy, umbilical hernia repair.
medical_history.family_history: Brother with myocardial infarction (MI), Father with MIs (died age unspecified).
